trustfund:
TF037579-RUSSIA - NORTH MIGRATION,TF037580-RUSSIA - MIGRATION PILOT,TF037759-RUSSIA - NORTH MIGRATION,TF039516-RUSSIAN FEDERATION - NORTHERN
            OUT MIGRATION PILOT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Northern Restructuring
            Project for Russian Federation were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: both the
            federal and local restructuring components provided support
            to develop or amend federal and municipal reforms in housing
            and utility services management as an integral part of
            increased management capacity of the federal and municipal
            level. The comprehensive approach to voluntary out-migration
            was essential in the effective demonstration of the
            cost-effective interventions supported by the project. The
            out-migration supported included essential elements such as
            voluntary outmigration, choice of recipient location, local
            restructuring plans, comprehensive information, and public
            relations campaigns. Projects' design should build
            flexibility to adjust on the basis of experience during
            implementation; project legal documentation should reflect
            this flexibility and implementation particularities should
            be included in the operational manual. Selection of a
            limited number of participating municipalities and using a
            pilot as the vehicle was the right instrument to test
            measures to support and expand outmigration.
